data.title: Six linked to call centre scams
data.description: Police arrested six people allegedly involved in call centre scams and the illegal firearms trade, the Cyber Crime Investigation Bureau (CCIB) announced yesterday, saying the suspects may have also financed the insurgency in the deep South.

data.title: PM touts economic plans
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra has pledged a raft of new populist measures to boost the economy and improve people

data.title: PPRP officially kicks out dissenting MPs
data.description: The Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP) has officially expelled 20 MPs who defected following a dispute between former party secretary-general Capt Thamanat Prompow and present party leader Prawit Wongsuwon.

data.title: Pheu Thai MP to pull anti-coup bill
data.description: Pheu Thai MP  Prayuth Siripanich  says he will withdraw a bill designed to prevent future  military coups  for revisions before resubmitting it to parliament.

data.title: MP to pull anti-coup bill
data.description: Pheu Thai MP  Prayuth Siripanich  says he will withdraw a bill designed to prevent future  military coups  for revisions before resubmitting it to parliament.

data.title: Phu Kradueng mountain closed after tourist’s death
data.description: The director-general of the Department of National Parks, Wildlife and Plant Conservation closed the popular Phu Kradueng mountain in Loei province after a tourist was fatally attacked by a wild elephant.

data.title: Opposition presses for tax-reform clarity
data.description: The opposition  People’s Party  on Thursday pressed the government to clarify its plans for  tax reform  after the latter floated ideas about restructuring the system, while the government insists everything is only at the study stage with no concrete proposals made yet.

data.title: PM criticised for House no-show
data.description: The absence of Prime Minister  Paetongtarn Shinawatra  from the opening of the new House of Representatives session on Thursday provoked a heated argument between the opposition and the coalition-leading  Pheu Thai  Party.

data.title: Malaysian state’s border wall proposal rejected
data.description: A plan pushed by  Kelantan  state to erect a  wall  on the  border  with Thailand’s Narathiwat province has hit a snag as the Malaysian home minister has shown no enthusiasm for it.

data.title: Ex-minister’s father held in slaying of adopted son
data.description: A veteran  Prachin Buri  politician and father of a former cabinet minister is facing a murder charge in the  shooting  death of his adopted son, a provincial councillor, over what police say was a political dispute.

data.title: First frost on Doi Inthanon
data.description: CHIANG MAI – The first frost of this winter season was seen on Doi Inthanon on Thursday morning as the temperature fell as low as 4°C, the coolest this year.

data.title: Fresh storm alert for southern Thailand
data.description: Flooding and landslide alerts are in effect for all southern provinces near the Gulf of Thailand, with torrential rain forecast to pound the region until next Monday.

data.title: Migrant worker welfare training
data.description: The Labour Ministry is training a working team to provide labour welfare protection for migrant workers while also keeping them from taking jobs reserved for Thais.

data.title: iCon probe ends this month
data.description: The Department of Special Investigation (DSI) says its investigation into the scandal-hit The iCon Group will be finished before Dec 20, when the detention of 18 suspects ends.

data.title: Democracy is in need of workers
data.description: Donald Trump shocked the world in 2016 when he was elected US president, winning swing states in America

data.title: Govt 'won't mess with military'
data.description: The government has no intention of intervening in the military after a Pheu Thai MP proposed a bill to revise the Defence Ministry Administration Act, said Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra.

data.title: PM hints at release of detained crew
data.description: Four Thai crew members of a fishing vessel detained in Myanmar are expected to be released shortly after the New Year, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra suggested on Wednesday.

data.title: PM to delegate opposition's questions
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra said she is ready to participate in the House general session when it convenes on Thursday.

data.title: Dozens of condo scam victims seek help
data.description: A group of 70 people have filed complaints with the Department of Special Investigation (DSI) claiming they were duped into purchasing  condominium units , resulting in total losses of 3 billion baht.

data.title: ‘No public forum’ on Cambodia pact
data.description: No public forum will be held on the controversial 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) with  Cambodia  on maritime claims  in the Gulf of Thailand, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra said on Wednesday.
